name: Residence Inn by Marriott Times Square New York

reviews.text: I have stayed at this hotel multiple times for business. It is in a great location, has great guestrooms and a great breakfast buffet. The night bellman is fantastic and remembers guests from previous years.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.text: I just got back from New York, June 22nd. This hotel was great. The price was awesome for TimeSquare. We had a King size bed, a Pullout sofa, Kitchenette with Full size Fridge with ice maker, microwave, utensils, cups and glasses.
reviews.title: Awesome Hotel

likes.liked: — awesome price for the location and amenities

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were looking directly at the Empire state building. This is definitely my hotel from now on. Nothing beats the prices i got and the location i got.
reviews.title: Understand all the rave

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I travel to NYC 3 to 4 times a year, but this was our first stay at the Residence Inn. This place had everything and more that we could need. The hotel is very clean and updated. I always felt secure and safe. The kitchen was so convenient and the bed was the most comfortable one I have been in among all of my NYC stays. The breakfast was fine, if you like carbohydrates. Two blocks to subway stop, close to Times Square, but not close enough to be bothered with all of the foot traffic. Will never stay anywhere else in NY again!!!!
reviews.title: Highly recommended
Super hotel - Great location
reviews.text: Having read good reviews on Trip Advisor we had high expectations of this hotel and were not dissapointed.

very friendly staff couldnt do enough for you, location good. rooms were very clean beds are so comfortable i wanted to take it home!! continental breakfast was good doesnt matter what time you arrive if something isnt there the staff are more than happy to get it for you. excellant hotel i will stay here again.
reviews.title: excellant
Great hotel
reviews.text: My teenage daughter and I stayed here for 3 nights. Great hotel for tourists. Very quiet and location was excellent for siteseeing. Easy to walk to TimeSquare and the subway station a few short blocks away. We even walked to the Theater district. Rooms were spacious for NYC and kitchen area was very nice even though we did not use it. Bed was very comfortable. Bathroom was very tiny but nice. Included breakfast was convenient but not great. They were often out of food and the staff seemed to have trouble keeping things stocked. Pretty much the same bland items each morning with little variety. The usual scrambled eggs, sausage, waffles , some okay looking muffins, toast, bagels, cereal, yogurt, and some fruit (which they always ran out of). The oatmeal would usually be out or almost out also. We never had a problem with the elevator or had to wait long even though the hotel was quite busy. Hotel has a computer and printer for guests in the lobby area and a concierge desk.

This is a good property, with nice rooms that feature full kitchens. Very nice lounge area, in which breakfast is provided. The lobby is small and gets crowded. The staff is helpful and efficient. Pretty good location, although is several blocks from a subway station (in Manhattan, there are plenty of hotels within a block of a subway station). The only complaint is that there isn't enough elevator capacity (I think re-programming them would solve the problem; there appear to be enough). This causes annoyingly long waits, especially at breakfast time.
reviews.title: Good, but not great

reviews.text: Stayed at the Residence Inn for 5 nights in Oct 07. We had a great stay, couldn't fault it at all. As it was for a special occasion I emailed to ask if we could be upgraded if there was any available & when we checked in we were offered a 3 windowed cornor suite, which gave us more room. The bed was very, very comfortable. Our son slept on the sofa bed which was ok, (he was so tried he would have slept on anything). The breakfast was great a good selection of hot & cold food, & it saved time in the mornings. We didn't have a problem with having to wait for the lifts but we were up early every day. Great location within walking distance of most attractions & shops. We can't wait to visit New York again & will stay at the Residence Inn if we can.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.text: My daughter, age 22, and I stayed at the Residence Inn Oct. 26 - 28 and had a wonderful experience. She was in New York for a Fashion Seminar, and I went along for the company and to sight see while she was busy. I had visited the marriott.com website to find out about properties in Times Square since I am a rewards member of the Marriott chain of hotels. I then called the hotel, and they guaranteed me the best price possible, and said they had a policy where I would not find a better price anywhere for their property. They were right!! The hotel staff was very helpful and we were able to have an early check in to help us out with our plans. Our room, in fact the entire hotel, was very clean and pretty in the furnishings. We appreciated the generous size of our suite, and all of the amenities that were included. The hotel has a fantastic location, and we could walk very quickly to Times Square, the subway, and many area attractions, which we liked. The complimentary breakfast was very tasty and generous, also. Again, the staff was very polite and helpful, and we would definitely stay at this property again.
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel

reviews.text: Excellent location, close to Times Sq/Broadway, Grand Central, and very convenient to the subway. Room was great, very comfy, modernized with flat screen TV & stainless steel appliances in kitchen although bathroom vanity was small. Sofa couch was used as a bed but it was just a wimpy coil mattress. Did not happen to get room with a good view. Buffet breakfast was the best with lots of choices.
reviews.title: Much better than expected

reviews.text: The Residence Inn, Times Square, was excellently located and perfect for our first trip to NYC. The room was comfortable, spotlessly clean and spacious (we had a corner studio suite). Our son found the sofa bed comfortable enough (we were a little worried, having read some not so favourable reviews on here). All the staff were friendly and helpful. The breakfast was good and plentiful and the evening light meals were useful for a quick bite to eat. We had no problems with the elevators - never had to wait longer than a couple of minutes. We don't have anything negative to say and will certainly stay here again should we return to New York.
reviews.title: Absolutely perfect!

reviews.text: Location cannot be beat. Steps from the subway and an easy walk to Empire State Building, tons of shopping, Broadway shows. The hotel was very nice and comfortable, breakfast was awesome. Couldn't wait to go to NYC for bagels every a.m. but couldn't drag ourselves from the buffet! Fabulous view of the Empire State Bldg. Laundry facilities too. Great for families. Front desk personnel great too. Can't imagine staying anywhere else!
reviews.title: Location, Location, Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed in midtown many times and will have to say that this was the best stay ever. The location cannot be beat. About 2 blocks to Times Square with plenty of restaurants, drugstores (for buying snacks and water) within a block. There is a subway station one (very short) block away. The room was spacious, quiet and we had no problems whatsoever. There is even a safe in the room! The hot breakfast was not spectacular, but was filling and just right to get you going on your day in NYC.
reviews.title: Awesome Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I have stayed at this property 3 times for long weekends (3 or 4 days) to a week. We have consistently received top service from every employee there whether it's the front desk personnel, the housekeeping staff, the breakfast employees and the security personnel. Every single employee is courteous and helpful. We arrived early after a red eye flight and were checked in immediately. Our room wasn't ready; however, they invited us to have breakfast upstairs and came to find us to personally deliver our room key before we were half way finished with our meal. The rooms are large and new - something unusual for New York. Beds are comfortable, rooms are spacious. It's wonderful to have room to stretch out! The bathrooms are small; however, they are clean and have everything you would want in the way of toiletries. We loved having the kitchen faclities even though we had breakfast every morning on the 3rd floor - a wonderful savings of time and cash in New York. The location is excellent - close to 5th avenue shopping - walking distance to the theatre district and Times Square. We have already made reservations to return next May. We wouldn't think of going anywhere else!
reviews.title: Best bet for New York

reviews.text: Our family of seven arrived on December 30th and were warmly received by front desk staff. When they found out it was our first visit to NYC, we were given a welcome gift with goodies, drinks, wine, and tourist info. The staff always greeted us when we were coming and going. The hotel is convenient for sight-seeing in NYC especially Times Square, Broadway, Empire State Bldg, Rockefeller Plaza, Macys, etc. Subway nearby to travel to Central Park, Ground Zero, Wall Street, Little Italy, and Chinatown. We also were only two blocks away to see the Times Square ball drop New Year's Eve. Nice spread for breakfast. Coffee and tea available all the time. Rooms very clean. Kids complained that sofa sleeper uncomfortable but I haven't met one yet that is comfortable. They're young so could handle it.
reviews.title: Nice stay at Residence Inn

likes.disliked: — had to keep getting the door key reprogrammed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here from 28 December 2008 to 2 Janurary 2009 to celebrate my 30th birthday and having read the very postitive reviews on trip advisor before we booked I was not disappointed when we arrived!
reviews.title: Love, Love, LOVED it

reviews.text: Staff were very friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: first class

reviews.text: Room was a good size, it was very clean and had a great view of the empire state building. The bed was large and extremely comfortable!
reviews.title: We had a great time at the Residence Inn

reviews.text: Breakfast was very good and FREE - unusual in NYC! Go early though, cos it does get very busy and the elevators are a nightmare if you go any later than 9am!
reviews.title: Great hotel, great location.

reviews.text: I have recently returned from my first visit to New York with my wife and 2 young children. I would first like to point out my respect for the excellent staff we met - from the porter, to housekeeping and reception staff. It was a busy time of year (between Christmas and New Year) and we felt welcomed and valued as customers.
reviews.title: Really Impressed

reviews.text: Our room (1808) was very spacious as was the bathroom - this may be because it was a disabled room. We had the sofa bed permanently made up and there was still plenty of space. The kitchen area was handy because we have a baby. The staff came to our room and made up the crib which was brilliant!
reviews.title: Great hotel, value and location,Family of Four should request an 08 room

reviews.text: We had a magical view of the Empire State Building!
reviews.title: nice location - very poor service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I read many reviews prior to travelling regarding the complimentary breakfast. Perhaps I had lower expectations because of these, but we found the breakfast both plentiful and of a satisfactory quality.
reviews.title: Liked the location
Excellent choice with children!!
reviews.text: The location of the hotel is terrific. You are literally 3 minutes walk from Macys at Herald Square. A further 2 minutes and you arrive at the Empire State Building. Madison Square Gardens is also very close by. Times Square is only 10 minutes walk away.
I stayed here with my wife and daughter over Thanksgiving Day weekend. It was ideally situated for us because we went to two musicals. Times Square is only several blocks away.
reviews.title: Good value

reviews.text: Herald Square, featuring Macy's and other shops, was also a short walk away.
reviews.title: Family Friendly, Convenient

reviews.text: The hotel has a nice breakfast that's included. So is the wireless Internet, which worked well.
reviews.title: Clean, comfortable and convenient location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The front desk clerk was nice enough to give us a room with a view of the Empire State Building.
reviews.title: The best Residence Inn-ever

reviews.text: I wouldn't stay here if I wanted to hang out in Central Park because it's a little too far to walk easily.
reviews.title: Wonderful for families!

reviews.text: I booked this hotel for a Friday night stay, $199/night special through Marriott's website, including breakfast. All of the reveiws were right on. It is an excellent hotel, beautiful, clean, staff was very accommodating and couldn't be more helpful. It is very wise to request a 20+ floor just for the sake of the elevators. There are 3, but they are a bit small. We were on the 24th floor, by the time the elevator stopped in the teens, it was full. Breakfast was very well stocked with the best selection I've seen at a buffett in a long time, many hot selections, not just the typical bagels, waffles, and danish. The area is fine and safe. It's a 10 block walk to the theater district, but if you walk down 6th to the 40's it is well lit and very populated. I'll definitely be going back!
reviews.title: Great Hotel!

reviews.text: My family (which includes 2 older teenagers) stayed at the Residence Inn in mid July. The hotel appears to be relatively new compared to many of the others I have stayed at in Manhattan. The front desk manager (Melissa Cantone), was very accomodating to our room request which made for a great stay. The breakfast buffet had everything you could want and allowed us to get an earlier start to our activities each morning. By the way, the coffee is great! The hotel is relatively close to Times Square so you can walk it. (more on that in a moment).
reviews.title: One of NYC's Best

likes.liked: — Breakfast Buffet and the hotel was new
likes.disliked: — Loved the hotel, If I could move it to 46th and Broadway it would be perfect.

reviews.text: We had the complimentary dinner buffet at the hotel just one night (hotdogs, chicken strips) and it was average (saved us some money on dinner one night!)
reviews.title: housekeeping was great

reviews.text: The concierge booked our Empire State Building tickets which saved us 20 - 30 minutes in line.
reviews.title: Excellent service, better than 4 star

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: People have complained about the elevator during breakfast hours and it was not too much of a problem for us since we were on a high floor. We were always the first ones on it and it opened up on most every floor beneath us (completely full) so there were some unhappy people on the lower floors. The breakfast buffet is on the third floor. Get a high room so you will not find a full elevator when it opens up on your floor!
reviews.title: Great value in NYC

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel states it is in Times Square which it isn't so we found the room price to be a little high ($599 for a Monday night). The room was somewhat small for a suite and the bathroom is just large enough for one person. The kitchen was a nice asset but make sure you request the burner to cook on. The staff on the front desk, bar and buffet were above average. The valet staff needs improvement but do take advantage of the service. All in all I would stay here again.
reviews.title: Great hotel right near the action!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Absolutely loved my stay at this hotel and will definitely try to stay there again. Got a $200 rate for a Saturday before Christmas...not bad. Got a room on the 32nd floor so very quiet and great view of the empire state building. Didn't need the kitchen but used the pull out sofa bed for our 6 year old. Loved, loved, loved the comfortable sheets and bed. It was heavenly!!! The buffet breakfast was perfect. It had scrambled eggs, sausage, bagels, and all the fixings (peanut butter, cream cheese, jelly, etc.), potatoes, pancakes, fruit bar, oatmeal, coffee and juice stations, yogurts, different breads, etc. I mean it was all we could want and more for an included breakfast. It kept me full all day. Yes, the elevators are slow and they stop on all the floors, but it wouldn't deter me from asking for the high floor again b/c it was so quiet. I thought it was spotless - the entire room and bathroom was very nice with nice tile, lighting and just very very clean and shining. I thought it was a steal! Walked one ave to l and t's for window shopping and couldn't have asked for a better location. Central to times square, and 5th ave, but quiet and not as hectic being on 6th ave. Can't wait to stay again. My daughter and husband loved it. We valet the car for $45. That took 30 min to pick up. The staff was very friendly and we had the quickets check in and check out ever. We live in NJ, and travel quite a bit, and this hotel was really really great.
reviews.title: Great Location - Friendly staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel's location can not be beat. It is withing walking distance of Times Square, Bryant Park, Rockefeller Center, 5th Avenue and so much more.
reviews.title: Excellent service, location and room

reviews.text: Service was simply excellent, prompt valet service, great concierge, helpful staff, excellent breakfast.
reviews.title: Second Stay also a Success

likes.disliked: — Not changing the linens when asked. Price also is high for what you get.

reviews.text: The room was the largest I have ever had in NY, very well appointed and super clean.
reviews.title: Great Hotel in NYC
Thanksgiving Stay
reviews.text: To top it off the price was unbeatable at $199.
I could not ask for better, it's a 5 star.
reviews.title: Great experience

reviews.text: This was a perfect hotel for a group of New York City newbies. Within walking distance to Rockafeller Center, Times Square and the Empire State Building. Also was very close to Grand Central Station making it easy to get anywhere else in the city.
reviews.title: Wonderful experience

likes.liked: — Friendly staff, close to tourist attractions
likes.disliked: — Pull out couch uncomfortable for 3rd person

reviews.text: The front desk staff was always friendly and responsive to our requests, at every hour of the day or night. Our housekeeper was very thorough.
reviews.title: Gem in Times Square

likes.liked: — The location and a comfortable room

reviews.text: The breakfast buffet was good, but had a somewhat limited selection.
reviews.title: Quiet, well-located and big rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our only complaint: We found the pull out couch bed to be pretty uncomfortable and ended up sleeping on the couch itself, not the pull out bed .
reviews.title: Fantastic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had read other reviews that commented on long delays waiting for elevators. We did not have any problems at all.
reviews.title: Great choice in Midtown
Loved this place!!
reviews.text: I stayed here overnight on the 9th of December with my mom and my son. I thought it was great- one of the cleanest rooms I've ever stayed in. The bed and pillows were super comfortable, which is always risky. The room was spotless, and the staff couldn't have been nicer. We dealt with at least 4 different staff members the two days we were there, and one was nicer than the last.
I also thought the breakfast was fantastic- hot and cold. I would definitely reccomend this hotel to anyone who wants to sight see- it's centrally located.
reviews.title: Great room, great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: So I think I've made my point- I loved it!!
reviews.title: Very good hotel for New York

likes.disliked: — only one internet point in lobby

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Fantastic location just a few blocks from times square, penn plaza, etc.
reviews.title: Great views

likes.liked: — The view from our room and the comfy bed!

reviews.text: Nice studio room with modern furniture, full kitchen, and comfy bed.
reviews.title: Excellent experience!

reviews.text: We've stayed here before, and this hotel continues to be one of the best bargains in NYC. My husband, 14-year-old daughter, and I stayed for two nights so we could see a couple of shows and concerts.
reviews.title: Another Great Stay

reviews.text: We booked a great rate on the Marriott website, and on the day we were to arrive I checked the website to see how full the hotel was. Lo and behold, the rate had been lowered! I contacted the hotel and Damien at the front desk put me in touch with reservations, who lowered my rate with no questions asked. I also spoke to Damien about the type of room we wanted, so that when we walked in the door a few hours later Damien had the type we wanted all ready for us. Front desk service continued to be outstanding throughout our stay.
reviews.title: Everything you'd want in a Marriott and more.

reviews.text: Our room was spotless and we had a great view. Our daughter slept in the pull-out sofa and had no complaints. We really enjoyed the convenience of the breakfast, especially since we could bring food upstairs for our daughter, who slept in. The kitchen in the room is perfect for heating up leftovers - you can save on food costs easily.
reviews.title: Home Touch

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Again, the location is outstanding - you are right near the subway and bus stops, and only a few blocks from Times Square and Grand Central Station.
reviews.title: Great location, great price, great experience

likes.liked: — Size and attractiveness of room, location, value

reviews.text: I'm a Marriott Platinum member so I'm used to being given some perks but I have to say the Marriott RI by Times Square was perhaps the best treatment I've received at any Marriott. The front desk ensured I got the room I wanted and continued to check on me. The one review mentioning the fact the staff remembers your name – it’s true. The rooms, although a little small for a RI were quiet and the views terrific. Yes, the elevators are crowed as is breakfast during peak hours but show 15 minutes early and its all good. It's close enough to many locations but far enough from Times Square. A good place to stay. And, free breakfast sure beats the $50 you have to pay at a local restaurant. Only bad thing, the concierge didn’t seem to want to be bothered by me and my son asking questions.
reviews.title: Beautiful room WITH a kitchen

reviews.text: Location is perfect, staff is pleasant and helpful, rooms are large and clean. For the price, you don't get much better than this.
reviews.title: Same as last time....Perfect!

reviews.text: I used Trip advisor Reviews to help in selecting The Residense Inn by Marriott Times square and was pleased with the results.
reviews.title: Best deal and great location

likes.liked: — The rooms are clean and quite large.

reviews.text: The hotel is in a great location for Times square, we could easily walk to theaters and dinning.
reviews.title: Agree with positive reviews of this hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in room 1606 and had a great view of The Empire State Building. The room was clean and large enough to comfortably handle three people with a king bed and pullout sofa. It was also nice to have a fridge to store some snacks and drinks.The included hot breakfast was a nice bonus.
reviews.title: Very Disappointed

reviews.text: We plan to stay at this hotel again and would highly recommend it.
reviews.title: business travellers, avoid this hotel

reviews.text: I took a quick trip with the Mr. last night,12/29. We only stayed one night. I can't say enough about the Residence Inn Marriott Times Square. Regina was at the front desk and she was outstanding. Helpful,pleasant,smiling! Howell was also at the front desk. He helped us find a nice restaurant for dinner and gave us several back up choices in case we changed out minds.
reviews.title: Loved everything about it......

reviews.text: Both of these people were full of information and eager to help us out. The room was spotless. The bed and linens were the best I have ever slept on,and I've been a few places! We took advantage of the free hot breakfast in the a.m. Get there early on busy weekdays and weekends. It was a bit crowded this morning,but it was over the holidays........Eggs,homefries,pastries,cereal..........yum!
reviews.title: Read this before you stay!

likes.liked: — Everything about it (location, safety, service, value, price, the whole deal!)
likes.disliked: — That every place I go to from now on will not compare to this hotel! :)

reviews.text: The location is perfect. We walked to Times Square and several other places,no sweat.
reviews.title: This place is GREAT!

reviews.text: We did have a bit of bad luck at the end,though no fault whatsoever of the Marriott. Our car was brought around by the Valet Staff and after loading up and trying to drive away,imagine our dismay to find our car would not start!!!!! Miday traffic,day before New Years Eve......stuck out in the road. The staff said NO problem........lets see if we can get some help for you. The valet guy brought his own car around and gave us a jump and within 15 mins. we were on our way!
reviews.title: Great Stay

likes.liked: — Helpful staff in NYC? Yes, absolutely.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I just can't say enough about our stay. From begining to end,a great time. I plan on writing to Marriott the old fashion way to let them know how wondeful this place is! Oh and the price was right too!!
reviews.title: Thanksgiving in New York, great location

likes.liked: — great location, great rooms, better than a normal hotel room, great breakfast
likes.disliked: — small bathroom, staff ignored rewards members requests, elevators busy

reviews.text: This hotel proved to be the perfect choice for four nights in the city for a 'sister's trip'. Three of us found the room workable with its pull out couch and though we didn't use the kitchen, the extra area gave a feeling of space. The location is fabulous, though 'Times Square' is quite a ways away. Everything was spotless and all the appointments looked as if they had just been replaced - curtains. linens, etc. seemed brand new. Though there is no real lobby, the lovely library-style space where breakfast is served, is as charming a relaxing public area as could be asked for. The staff is welcoming and helpful - just delightful - and the nearby Simply Pasta and Bryant Park Grill restaurants are great choices for lunch or dinner.
reviews.title: Really Top Notch

reviews.text: I'd go back in a heartbeat!
reviews.title: Absolutely Ideal!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed from 22 Dec through to Jan 5. After months and months of research, I booked 2 rooms here ( 2 adults 4 teens). Without a doubt we picked a brilliant hotel.
reviews.title: Great location, Great Service

reviews.text: The hotel was spotlessly clean, the beds are THE BEST we have ever slept on. Yes bathroom is small, but I knew that beforehand from other reviews. We prefer a clean bathroom to a big one.We had a teen ( 18 & 15 )sleep on each sofa in each room, they didn't complain once, so obviously fine.
reviews.title: Another great Marriott experience

reviews.text: Yes elevators are slow at 9.00am, so that was great incentive to get to breakfast at 8.15. So instead of people whinging, just get up a touch earlier, then fit more into your day.
reviews.title: Loved The Residence Inn !!!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Residence Inn for 4 nights having booked our stay via the Marriott central reservation centre.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.text: When we booked our stay we did encounter some problems regarding the price quoted and what we were charged, which we weren’t happy with. However, upon arriving at the hotel we were advised that consequentially the hotel manager Gwen had upgraded us to a 1 bedroom suite on the 32nd floor with a view of the Empire State Building - we thought this was fantastic service considering the problem with the booking was the fault of central reservations (who did nothing) and not the hotel.
reviews.title: Fab hotel

likes.liked: — Excellent rooms and location. Very friendly staff. Excellent free breakfast. Relaxing lounge.
likes.disliked: — No internal stairs to allow the choice of taking stairs instead of elevator.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room itself was really spacious and the view was great. The complementary breakfast was good with lots of choice and there was also free internet access.
reviews.title: Loved the residence inn

reviews.text: The location of the hotel was really good, a short walk to the Empire State Building, Time Square and 5th Avenue. To go further afield (Statue of Liberty, Wall Street etc) we bought tickets for the red bus tour which we could use for 72 hours and found these to be really good value.
reviews.title: Great experience

reviews.text: Overall, we had a really good stay at the Residence Inn and would definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Didn't Disappoint!!

reviews.text: Great location! 5-10minutes walking distance to times square and the hopOnHopOff bus, 5 blocks from empire state building, and several choices of small restaurant in the surrounding areas.
reviews.title: Great locations! Hotel is quite good! Breakfast is ok!

reviews.text: Hotel and room is quite good, not the 5star but it is as what I expected.
reviews.title: Hotel has great potential..and great customer service

reviews.text: Check in process is very fast.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.text: This is a Residence Inn in a great location in New York City. The rooms are a great size and the beds are comfortable. They are clean and a good deal for the location. A wonderful breakfast buffet (huge selection) is included, but get down to the buffet at least a half hour before it is scheduled to end. All rooms have small kitchens, which is a nice plus for extended stay people.
reviews.title: Great area, basic hotel

reviews.text: Unfortunately, my room had a number of small problems. Fortunately, the management really cares and supplied EXCELLENT customer service...at all levels. Another plus: they have maid and maintenance service available around the clock. YEAH!!! REALLY!!
reviews.title: Times Square Marriott

reviews.text: Spent the weekend of the Ing NY marathon 2011, At this hotel. Big room for NY with a mini kitchen and a pull out a sofa bed. We had 3 adults in the room and found it pretty comfortable. Good beds. Great free breakfast ( a savings of about $10.00 per person per day) and a nice bar to chill out in later in the day. The staff were very attentive to our every need. Bryant Park is across the street and Times Square a block or two the other direction. There is a subway stop a block away.
reviews.title: Great place to stay in NYC

reviews.text: Just two blocks from Times Square, our room had a great view of Empire State Building! i work for Marriott so my standards are high, but Tito did a great job checking us in!
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.text: Real quick, Here's how to get to the property from the Airport:
reviews.title: Best value in NYC

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Take the Airtrain to Jamaica Center. Before you leave towards the subway, find a guy selling the 7-day unlimited pass ($29) BRING CASH! When we finally made our way to the subway, the machines were down and we had to walk all the way back. These guys are legitimate and the ticket machines seem to be unreliable.
reviews.title: Great Location, Great Rooms, Great Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Take the E train towards Downtown or World Trade Center until you get to the Forest Hills 71 ave exit. From there hop on the F train towards Stillwell & Downtown. Exit at 42nd street Bryant Park. When you get out of the subway, go out of the "40th street SW Corner" exit. This will take you right in front of the Residence Inn's doors. We stayed here the weekend before thanksgiving.
reviews.title: Great choice for the Big Apple

reviews.text: We (couple with a teenager) stayed here over Christmas 2007, and loved
reviews.title: Fantastic!

reviews.text: it! We've just had a month long trip to the USA, and this was absolutely the best hotel we stayed in. We were on the 23rd floor, and
reviews.title: Great Stay in NY - Dec 07

reviews.text: the only (small) problem we had was with the elevators being extremely
reviews.title: Great location, good for an extended stay

reviews.text: slow at peak times.
reviews.title: Great Location

likes.disliked: — moldy smell and reoccuring alarms going off in room

reviews.text: The staff were excellent, the breakfasts were wonderful - I have no idea why anyone would complain about the selection or quantity. Every single day there was ample selection and amounts. We only went to the evening social hour one night out of the eight nights that we stayed, but it was good, too.
reviews.title: Residence Rocks!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here for a long weekend. The location is very close to Bryant Park, which had an ice skating rink, small vendor booths, food booths, and some nice restaurants. I highly recommend the Crepe booth in Bryant Park for a great snack! The hotel is also very convenient for walking to Hells Kitchen area for dining and to Broadway shows. It was nice to be close to Times Square without the craziness of staying right on it. We also walked to Central Park one day, which was a little over a mile away. The room was quite large, except the bathroom, and had a full fridge, a microwave, and a surprisingly comfortable bed. We did not have the breakfast offered at the hotel, so I cannot comment on that.
reviews.title: Great location and good sized rooms

reviews.text: First off, the hotel offers Valet Parking (from the local garage) but being NYC, it is very hard to find a spot to leave your car to check-in. We left ours (not exactly in front of the hotel but next to the garage) and before the valet arrived I got a $115 ticket (ouch!). The rooms are very small for a RI but location to Times Square and Broadway was great. We had a room with a view of the Empire State bldg. The staff was very friendly and breakfast was very good. I just wish I had been warned before I left my car.
reviews.title: Not your typical Residence

reviews.text: My husband, young son and I stayed here for three nights. We couldn't have asked for a better location. The hotel is conveniently located to Bryant Park, Macy's, the Empire State Building, Penn Station, and more. We walked everywhere from midtown to Central Park. We were pleasantly surprised with the size of the room, which includes a kitchen and sitting area. Our window looked out to the ESB. The free continental breakfast and friendly service were a nice a bonus. Definitely recommend this hotel for families and friends traveling together. Great place!
reviews.title: Great location, good size rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just stayed here for a short shopping and Radio City Christmas show. The location was very convenient for both and only a block from Bryant Park that currently has an ice rink for skating, small vendor shops set up and a couple of nice restaurants. The staff at the hotel were very friendly and helpful. Very good breakfast.
reviews.title: Great location and service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed 14 nights at the end of October / early November 2011 and would definitely recommend it to friends. We paid extra to stay on a higher floor and were given a corner room on the 34th floor. We had an astonishingly comfortable king-size bed, a sitting area with couch, armchair and coffee table as well as a decent-sized kitchen - which we used for not much more than cups of tea. We had great views up 6th Ave and across to the east. The morning sun in the room was lovely. The bathroom was tiny but adequet. The water-saver shower-head was less than wonderful but water-efficient I guess. The outstanding thing about this hotel is the breakfast which cannot be faulted. This was our first vist to New York and we hated Times Square so next trip we would stay more toward Chelsea or Soho. An added bonus of our stay was the ice-rink and market setup in Bryant Park behind the Library which was excellent.
reviews.title: Very Central, very comfortable

aka: Residence Inn By Marriott Times Square New York Hotel New York City
description: Built in 2005 modern highrise in great location.
